text: Lauro Ortega Martínez (June 8, 1910 - July 22, 1999) was a Mexican politician and veterinarian. He served as the Governor of Morelos from 1982 to 1988, succeeding Armando León Bejarano. Ortega also served as the national President of the Institutional Revolutionary Party, Mexico's longtime ruling party, during the 1960s. He died from heart attack on July 22, 1999, aged 89. ==See also== *List of people from Morelos, Mexico ==References== Category:1999 deaths Category:1910 births Category:Governors of Morelos Category:Presidents of the Institutional Revolutionary Party Category:Institutional Revolutionary Party politicians Category:People from Morelos Category:Politicians from Morelos Category:Politicians from Mexico City Category:Mexican veterinarians Category:20th-century Mexican politicians Category:National Autonomous University of Mexico alumni
title: Lauro Ortega Martínez
